answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of articles that discuss community advisory boards and the systems  those communities have adopted to keep citizens engaged.
This article discusses how the City of Olathe, KS increased its citizen participation in government activities.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2872/Community_Facilitation
“One City's Success: Citizen Involvement in Financial Planning”, discusses how Huntington Woods, MI used citizen input on their financial planning committee.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7329/One_Citys_Success_Citizen_Involvement_in_Financial_Planning 
This article details the best ways to bring citizens on to police review boards. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7200/Selling_Your_Community_on_a_Citizens_Review_Board 
“Making Citizens' Task Forces Work”, examines the best ways to keep citizens engaged in committee activities.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4690/Making_Citizens_Task_Forces_Work 
You can view Alachua County Advisory Board Management System below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/20518/Advisory_Boards_Management_System 
Additionally, some communities have looked to younger citizens as a way to foster civic engagement early on. One such example of this is in Great Falls, MT.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5505/Geat_Falls_Teens_to_Join_City_Commission 
I also included a sample Student Advisory Council Resolution from the City of Titusville, FL.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9284/The_City_of_Titusville_Floridas_Student_Advisory_Council_Resolution 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

text: I'm looking for articles on how to effectively manage city boards and commissions - e.g. how to keep them interested, active and engaged.
title: Managing Boards and Commissions
